page.title: 08MANOR FARM AND CROSSLOW FARM
page.content:
We live at Manor Farm in Alsop en le Dale. My dad has about 200 acres. He has about 50 pigs, 252 sheep and 28 cows. We use all our fields for grass to feed the animals. We have no help on the farm, just me, my dad, my brother and my mum.
We take the cows and sheep to sell at Bakewell market. A man comes to take the pigs to Derby. The sheep have their lambs in March. We keep them all Winter and sell them the following year.
Cross Low Farm is my granddad's farm. It is a dairy farm and he milks 100 cows. A tanker lorry comes to collect the milk about 10.00a.m. every day.
My granddad gets up at 5.00a.m. He has got seven tractors, all Fords.
